ceasar.name: Ceasar Cipher
ceasar.description: To encode a message you have to create a new alphabet. To do so, you have to change a position of every letter by few places, which number you can specify in `shift` parameter. Then you replace every letter in your message with corresponfing letter from new alphabet.

shift.name: shift
shift.description: Specifies the number of positions by which the letters will be shifted.

alphabet.name: alphabet
alphabet.description: Specifies which alphabet to use as a base. Default is English. Options: pl - Polish, en - English

switch.name: Switch Cipher
switch.description: To encode a message you need the `switch key`. The key consists of letter pairs. To encode a message you replace every letter with the letter it is in pair with. In case the letter isn't present in the key, it is left the same.

switchKey.name: switch key
switchKey.description: Specifies the letter pairs. The letters musn't be repeated. The pairs must be separated with the '-' character. Example key: ga-de-ry-po-lu-ki.
